newsitem.title: USA: UPS, Teamsters take break from talks, resume later.
newsitem.headline: UPS, Teamsters take break from talks, resume later.

text.p: United Parcel Service and Teamsters Union negotiators broke off from marathon all-night talks at 5:30 a.m. EDT Friday without a settlement, but mediators said they would resume at 1 p.m.
"There have been substantive discussions of each party's position throughout the night. At this time we have decided to recess until this afternoon," said mediator John Calhoun Well.

Union and UPS bosses worked through the night at the Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service in downtown Washington DC after the expiry of a midnight strike deadline that would have paralysed the nation's biggest parcel carrier.
Teamsters president Ron Carey said the strike action would not go ahead while both sides were still negotiating.
"We will go to work as normal," he told reporters after the talks went into recess. However, he said the 200,000 union members were preapred to go on strike if necessary.
UPS Chief Exectuive Officer James Kelly declined to comment on the status of negotiations.
